meanings.definition: A person who has been sent back to their own country.
meanings.sent1: The repatriates were happy to be back home with their families.
meanings.sent2: The government welcomed the repatriates with open arms.
meanings.sent3: The repatriates shared stories of their adventures abroad.
meanings.sent4: The repatriates were like migratory birds returning to their nests.
meanings.sent5: The repatriates' joy at returning home was palpable.

meanings.definition: To send someone back to their own country.
meanings.sent1: The embassy repatriates citizens in times of crisis.
meanings.sent2: The organization repatriates stranded travelers efficiently.
meanings.sent3: The airline repatriates lost luggage to its owners.
meanings.sent4: The captain repatriates the crew after a long voyage.
meanings.sent5: The government repatriates its citizens safely and swiftly.

meanings.definition: To return to one's own country.
meanings.sent1: After years of living abroad, she finally repatriates to her homeland.
meanings.sent2: He repatriates every summer to spend time with his family.
meanings.sent3: The student repatriates after completing his studies overseas.
meanings.sent4: The soldier repatriates with pride after serving his country.
meanings.sent5: The artist repatriates to seek inspiration from her roots.
